                                                   Relaxation Oasis                                                        Calming Corner mp3s                                                                                         Yoga Room                                                                                         Ask the Stresspert                                         Please keep in mind that mindfulness techniques are meant to be used in conjunction with, not as a substitution for, services offered by trained health professionals.   The Mindfulness Initiative is a joint collaboration between Counseling and Wellness Services and the Wellness Exchange . This initiative was founded on the belief that mindfulness, the simple act of being aware of one's experience in the present moment, can be transformative to the NYU community. The practice of mindfulness promotes good health of mind, body and spirit by helping members of the community cope with the many challenges of academic life and make choices that aid in living life to the fullest. The mission of the Mindfulness Initiative is to integrate the instruction and practice of mindfulness into the services provided through the Student Health Center, promoting compassion, well-being, and academic success. The Initiative emphasizes a non-sectarian approach to mindfulness, drawing on the contemplative practices of a variety of traditions.   The information presented on these pages may not be duplicated without express permission from New York University. Click on one of the following mp3s for a guided relaxation exercise. Want relaxation to go? These mp3s are downloadable - right click and save to your mp3 player.   Please keep in mind that mindfulness techniques are meant to be used in conjunction with, not as a substitution for, services offered by trained health professionals. Regular practice improves flexibility, posture, circulation and balance. It also improves concentration, teaches us to relax, be more present and helps to make us stronger both physically and emotionally. Try one of these yoga sequences and see how it goes!   Please note: The following yoga poses are not suitable for everyone. They are in no way intended as a substitute for medical care. Please consult your doctor before beginning this or any other exercise program in order to reduce the risk of injury. Use discretion when performing the following postures. Work at your own level and be aware of your limits.   Click images below for full sequence and descriptions (PDFs).
